item.title: Project 2 – Laravel REST API & DevOps
item.description:
Overview

Project 2 takes the Concert REST API from Project 1 and upgrades it using modern tools:

  • Re-implemented the API using Laravel
  • Automated deployment with a shell script (run.sh)
  • Containerized the app with Docker and Docker Compose
  • Re-implemented the documentation using Hugo + PaperMod as a portfolio site
  • Set up GitHub Actions to automatically deploy the Hugo site to GitHub Pages (GitHub.io)

This project is designed to be a professional portfolio piece that shows both backend and DevOps skills.

item.title: Concert REST API – Project 1
item.description:
Overview

This project implements a Concert REST API that supports:

  • Users and authentication
  • Venues
  • Concerts
  • Ticket bookings

Clients can:

  • Register and log in
  • View/create venues
  • View/create concerts
  • Book tickets for a concert

This documentation was originally written as a Marp slide deck and has been re-implemented here as a Hugo page for my portfolio site.

Tech Stack

  • PHP REST API
  • MySQL database (managed through phpMyAdmin)
  • XAMPP for local development
  • NGINX for deployment
  • cURL / HTML pages for testing

item.title: Project 1 – Concert REST API
item.description:
Overview

Project 1 is a Concert REST API that provides:

  • User registration and login
  • Venue management
  • Concert management
  • Ticket booking

The API is built with PHP and MySQL and was originally documented with Marp slides, which I later converted into this Hugo page for my portfolio.

Responsibilities

  • Designed the database schema (users, venues, concerts, bookings)
  • Implemented PHP endpoints for all CRUD operations
  • Added simple token-based authentication using Bearer tokens
  • Tested endpoints using cURL and browser tools
  • Deployed the API behind an NGINX server

What I Learned

  • How to design a REST-style backend
  • How to connect PHP to MySQL and use foreign keys
  • Basics of server configuration and deployment with NGINX
  • How to write technical documentation and later migrate it into a static site generator (Hugo)
